Talon:

Talon followed Guardia, with her blaster ready for anything.


OOC:=
 sorry for suddenly pops her but I liked to start to come back to action ri=
ght now




From: Kraftlos 
Sent: Saturday, October 24, 2009 12:54 AM
To: n=
bwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: The Old Maximal Base


  Guardia toggle=
d her radio and leaned slightly.  "It appears we've run into something.  We=
're going to investigate.  Could we get a scanner sweep from above?"

"Beep=
....... Passive scanners are not picking up anything," replied someone from=
 the shuttle, then Lord Perseus spoke.  "If this is a threat, we can't risk=
 lighting up our active scanners.  Given our situation, we need to maintain=
 a low profile.  Investigate with caution.  If you make contact with hostil=
es, try to take cover and we'll move in to back you up."  

"Rodger..." 

G=
uardia motioned in the direction Tuscon appeared to be pointing, and the te=
am began to move.

"Perseus says investigate cautiously.  Let's get this ov=
er with," she grumbled.




On Fri, Oct 23, 2009 at 11:43 PM, Sandy <magicq=
uartz@...> wrote:

  As if being hit by a blunt object, the ping Tucs=
on had been waiting for comes in loud and clear.  It jolts him into a start=
le, which causes him to jump back slightly.  Instead of firing, he narrows =
his vacant eyes and moves his head in the direction of the ping.

  " I got=
 it!  Signal is very strong, and it seems to be scattered in all directions=
.  This could be good or not so good.  Guardia's right, we have to stay out=
 of the line of sight.  It's a strong signal too.  If I don't turn down my =
sonar systems they'll dull my hearing capabilities.  Not to mention this is=
 giving me one Hell of a processor ache!  C'mon, c'mon!  Give me a definite=
 direction!  Where is the primary source of this signal?!"

  He sends out =
another wave, and then, another ping.  This time, from one direction , one =
source.  He turns himself toward it and points to it.

  " That way.  It's =
coming from THAT direction.  The closser I go to it, the stronger it become=
s."

  He transforms.  He was quite antsy to find out who or what the signa=
l was bouncing off of.






  --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kra=
ftlos@...> wrote:
  >

  > "What is it?" asked Guardia.  "Have we been noti=
ced?"
  >
  > Ravenchief and the rest of the team pull out their weapons an=
d look around
  > the area.  The old base lay due north, its doors lay in a=
 slag heap a few
  > meters from the entrance; apparently untouched since t=
he battle.
  >
  > "Should I go up and take a look around from above?" Rave=
nchief suggested.
  >
  > "No, that'd just make you a target, let's play th=
is safe until we know what
  > we're dealing with here." she replied.
  >
